article.title: DynCorp to Support Unmanned and Manned Aircraft
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: DynCorp International, Fort Worth, Texas, is being awarded nearly $93 million to provide organizational level maintenance and logistic support on all aircraft and support equipment for which the Naval Test Wing Atlantic has maintenance responsibility.Â This maintenance responsibility includes all rotary, fixed, lighter-than-air, and unmanned aircraft on-site for project testing, transient aircraft, loaner aircraft, leased aircraft, and tested civilian aircraft assigned to the Naval Air Warfare Center Aircraft Division, Patuxent River, Maryland, which is the contracting activity.
